description: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (1/6). Nothing seemed to predestine her to become one of the greatest stars of French cinema. Yet the young actress, born to an Algerian father and a German mother, experienced a meteoric rise. She made her debut on stage at barely 17 years old and quickly transitioned to film.

description: Residents of Donetsk and other parts of the Donbas region occupied by Russia since 2014 are suffering from a water shortage that threatens to escalate into a humanitarian catastrophe.

headline: Baidu, China's robotaxi leader, sets sights on Europe
description: The Chinese tech giant, in partnership with American company Lyft, aims to launch driverless ride-hailing services in Germany and the United Kingdom in 2026. While China and the US are driving the robotaxi revolution, Europe remains a bystander.

headline: France overpowers Italy to open women's Rugby World Cup with shutout victory
description: Les Bleues battled through a scrappy first half before pulling away in Exeter, scoring three tries and keeping Italy scoreless to seal a 24–0 victory in their Pool D opener.

headline: From Brittany to the Alps, French cities restrict holiday homes
description: Faced with the challenge of housing the residents of highly touristic or attractive cities, some mayors have decided to ban the construction of new vacation properties.

How the 2024 Olympics transformed Greater Paris into a supersized stadium
description: Previously unpublished data on visitor numbers in Paris and its suburbs during the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games reveal how the city and its residents adapted, and how the Games accelerated Paris's transformation.

headline: Being a writer in the digital age? James Baldwin 'seemed free in ways we no longer can be'
description: 'Letters from America' (6/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams envies the great American author's bohemian, technology-free existence, despite the chaos it represented.

headline: In 'Kolkhoze,' Emmanuel Carrère becomes his mother's son
description: In his new book, the French author reflects on his often tumultuous relationship with his late mother, Hélène Carrère d'Encausse, and explores what he owes her. This major work addresses themes of death, love and writing.
